Validators don’t have free will. The rules of the protocol are deterministic. You either follow the rules or you don’t validate. Unlike with Bitcoin, where miners have free will to choose which transactions to include or exclude in a block.
Well, Bitcoin needs miners. It’s just a fact. They have complete control over which transactions to include (or exclude) in a block. I believe it’s really cryptocurrency.

Raw blockchain size is a less severe issue. Index size becomes a matter of hard drive seek bandwidth. Rotational drives simply can't keep up with ethereum or bitcoin-with-extra-indices (txindex) these days, due to the need to "seek all over the place" for each hash-keyed record

# Bitcoin folks should not become smug in light of # ethereum # blockchain 's size issues; Bitcoin and cousins (LTC, ZEC, QTUM, ...) face same core issue: Index (UTXO, etc.) working set size is becoming too large for single-machine key/value databases like leveldb.
